relationships.description: Managing Director, Senior Wealth Planning Strategist
President issues budget through Treasury Department

analysis.purpose: To inform readers about tax provisions in President Obama's Fiscal Year 2014 budget proposal and provide analysis of their potential impact
analysis.significance: Provides detailed analysis of proposed tax changes that would affect high-income taxpayers, retirement accounts, estate planning, and investment strategies

notable_quotes: The proposal would therefore cap the size of a taxpayer's various retirement accounts by barring additional contributions if, in total, the accounts exceeded what was necessary to provide the maximum annuity permitted for a defined benefit plan.
Trying to reconcile the Republican desire for lower rates and a broader tax base with the Democratic desire for higher taxes on those they feel can best afford them will not be easy.
This new proposal seems to be a reaction to this fall's presidential elections and the significant retirement accounts of one of the contenders.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this tax policy analysis document

illegal_activity.description: Document discusses proposed tax policy changes and legislation, not illegal activities

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a publicly distributed tax analysis newsletter from Deutsche Bank discussing publicly announced budget proposals

analysis.summary: This document is a tax policy analysis newsletter from Deutsche Bank that examines the tax provisions in President Obama's Fiscal Year 2014 budget, including proposals to limit tax benefits for high-income earners, implement the 'Buffett Rule,' change estate tax parameters, and restrict retirement account contributions and distributions.
